name: The Old Vicarage at Rye Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well we were when we first arrived, but def were not by the time we left, our room was beautiful, nothing was too much trouble, great breakfasts, a little something to have with our tea when we came back in the afternoons (all home made) Tracey & Simon could not have done more to make us feel so welcome. Would thoroughly recommend to all.
reviews.title: Strangers to the Marsh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The owners are really nice, the rooms are perfect (very cosy, clean and brand new), breakfast is great (try the bacon!)
reviews.title: Very friendly, rooms are perfect. A bit out of the way, but worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend it for a romantic trip or a family one.
reviews.title: Best B&B in Rye

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside: it's a bit out of the way, unless you want to have a walk on the (windy) beach. You definitely need a car.
reviews.title: Our stay at The Old Vicarage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in Rye at least 2or 3 times a year for several years but the welcome at The Old Vicarage is second to none. From the warm welcome by Tracy and Simon to the comfortable bed not forgetting the home made Danish Pastries just out of the oven for breakfast we will be returning very soon.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I wanted a pieceful weekend away from the big smoke and this place was perfect!
reviews.title: Wonderful Break Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although only a flying visit, Tracey and Simon made our stay extremely enjoyable. We stayed in The Harbour Suite. The room was clean, nicely decorated and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: A lovely getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were so welcoming and even made us some homemade cheese straws and cupcakes to take home with us, as we were unable to stay for breakfast as we had to rush of to Twickenham for the rugby. Little touches such as these really make a difference to your stay!
reviews.title: A very peaceful Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Old Vicarage and will definitely stay again in future!
reviews.title: Ideal for birdwatchers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most wonderful B&B with lovely hosts Simon and Tracey, who shared tips and anecdotes about the place and area. Breakfast was top quality, including scrumptious homemade muffins, free-range eggs and delicious local sausages. The en suite room was very comfortable, clean, tastefully decorated and provided a lovely view on the seafront. We thoroughly enjoyed the peaceful area. Will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Wish for a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having stayed at and written about The Old Vicarage before, I can really only echo my comments from my previous review in that to us it is like a home away from home, Tracey and Simon really are the perfect hosts of their fantastic B&B.
reviews.title: Another Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights (and wished we were staying for longer!) in the Martello Room this time and just like The Harbour Suite, it is a really gorgeous room and has a really, really comfortable sleigh bed. Breakfast again was excellent, as were Tracey’s chocolate muffins (the best we’ve tasted!) and we enjoyed a very relaxing two days.
reviews.title: Relaxed retreat by the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a beautiful, peaceful place to stay then look no further than The Old Vicarage, you will not be disappointed. We will be back again!!
reviews.title: first class experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B was one of the best I have had the pleasure of visiting. A beautiful double fronted Victorian house at the end of a quiet lane, looking over to the harbour. A welcoming host and hostess offered cups of tea and gorgeous homemade shortbread when we arrived after a long hot drive. We were delighted to be shown the Harbour Suite - a huge double room, plus a dressing room and vast bathroom. Everything was immaculate. Breakfast was a pleasure, sitting at a large dining table with other guests and chatting. A great choice of cooked breakfasts, plus a range of homemade treats such as granola, energy bars and cheese straws. All served with a smile. We were able to sit in the garden and soak up the sun and there was no sense of being in the way. A really lovely spot, worth another visit.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely, friendly, helpful owners who run an immaculate B&B service in their super and well appointed home close to the sea at Rye Harbour.
reviews.title: Great hospitality, lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simon & Tracy are wondeful hosts, Very clean rooms, wonderful views and decore. Breakfast superb, location coastal, wonderful walks. Close to Rye, Great pub down the road, Parking secure on site. Would recomend to all.
reviews.title: Classic Rye B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’re giving a gold medal to The Old Vicarage! It was such a good move when we chose to stay here for 4 nights way back in the middle of June. Our room, The Harbour Suite, was well equipped, comfortable and quiet. Tracy’s breakfasts were first class and a favourite of mine were the scrambled eggs straight from the hens on the family farm. The warm welcome we received from Tracy and Simon just added to what was a very enjoyable Birthday break.
reviews.title: An excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The owners Simon and Tracy really made our visit extra special, the service and attention to detail was second to none, if you are wanting to be pampered then this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the old vicarage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They took care of all our needs and the food at the B&B was exceptional.
reviews.title: This is no ordinary B and B!
Absolute gem with amazing hosts!
reviews.text: If we come back to Rye, then i wouldn't want to stay anywhere else, thank you so much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay with Tracey and Simon for our first wedding anniversary. We had the suite which was gorgeous. The cupcakes left in our room were very thoughtful and all of Tracey's cooking was superb. We were made to feel very welcome from the minute we arrived. We enjoyed using their bikes and exploring the nature reserve.
reviews.title: Very homely and luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal if you want to go onto the Rye Harbour Reserve, the Room was great (Harbour suite), Food excellent, charming and helpful hosts- really can not say a lot more except looking forward to going back, and in this case less is more in terms of the review but there is a 200 word minimum
reviews.title: No Faults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed for a night, but honestly, you only have to be there for five minutes to know that this place ticks all the right boxes. For a start, the house and gardens are beautiful, and are in a good location, especially if you're walking. We were given such a warm welcome (it was my birthday, Tracey and Simon left some very lovely cupcakes in our room), the service was great (we were picked up and dropped off at the station, and also very well looked after), the room was a good size and tastefully decorated, the beds were comfortable and the whole place was so clean. My god was it clean! The bathroom looked like it came straight from the showroom. Not a fingerprint, smear or even watermark anywhere in it.
reviews.title: The Perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't get a chance to try the cuisine, (apart from cupcakes, homemade shortbread and a packed lunch, which were all delicious) but if the other reviews here are anything to go by, the kitchen is run with the same attention to detail and professionalism as everything else.
reviews.title: Treat yourselves !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is how you run a bed and breakfast. In fact, this is how you run any hospitality industry business. Hoteliers, restaurateurs and cafe owners take note. You could learn a lot from a visit here.
reviews.title: 2nd time we have stayed at The Old Vicarage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend getaway following a recommendation.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is absolutely one of the best Hotels or B&Bs that I have stayed in. Everything was fantastic...I have paid much more for far less on many occasions.
reviews.title: mini break peter marilyn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: The place was spotless and really well appointed, fantastic grounds too. Simon and Tracey were marvellous hosts, relaxed and yet welcoming. Their breakfast was great as was the homemade shortbread on arrival - a nice touch. A lift into Rye was also much appreciated in the rain as were the recommendations on places to see, eat and drink.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, spacious and with more then a touch of luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rye Harbour is also a great spot, a little bit too far to walk into Rye (and certainly not the most attractive route) but who cares? Rye Harbour is a perfect base for relaxing and enjoying a pint or two!!!
reviews.title: Birthday Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll be back.
reviews.title: Top Notch B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, to loading the cases back in the car to leave, we found our own little space in heaven in Rye Harbour! Simon and Tracey are fantastic hosts and The Old Vicarage is a truly well presented, well looked after, warm, comforting and welcoming B&B.
reviews.title: A Little Piece Of Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in The Harbour Suite and it was spacious, clean and beautifully furnished. The large bed was so comfortable, I noticed on waking on the first morning of our stay that it was the first time I’d woken without back pain for longer than I can remember! Our 17 month old daughter loved the suite and spent the entire time wandering about and exploring, so much so that we wondered if she was ever going to sit down in one place!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: We happened to enjoy two late days of summer during our stay and made the most of this by taking the short walk down to the beach with an ice cream from the cart just outside the gates, it was all just so relaxing.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, fantastic people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great too, my wife being more of a fruit and cereal person, enjoyed the fresh ‘healthier’ options on offer, while I indulged in the good old English breakfast which was cooked to perfection. We finished off breakfast with some really nice cupcakes too!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't praise this place highly enough, my wife and I usually make a yearly trip to the Cotswolds for our ‘staycation’ weekends, but on the way home all we could talk about was going back to Rye Harbour and staying at The Old Vicarage again for our annual pamper!
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personally I hope no one ever finds this gorgeous place so we never have a problem staying here. Doubt that very much though as its just fantastic and sure word of mouth alone will ensure this lovely B&B was full 100% all the time. The couple that run the B&B are so interesting, friendly, helpful and kind. I am struggling to think what to put in this review 1st. Breakfasts were an absolute treat, with fresh fruit, home made muffins and anything that you could hink to ask for was on offer. We so enjoyed the fab evening meal the 1st evening, we stayed in the 2nd evening and had another wonderful homecooked meal. I love the idea that you can even order in a take away and they will let you use the dining room. We were two cyclists and they couldn't have made us more welcome, with secure storage and when we came back absolutley dripping they were waiting with a wash basket so we could dump all our wet gear in it, even offerering to try and get it dry bless them. The rooms are spotless , showers those new blast you everywhere type, with lovely smellies as well. As it was my birthday whilst we were there Tracey made two fantastic chocolate muffins, beautifully decorated, with a card and some sweetpeas from their own garden. We will be going back and staying longfer next time.. thats if we can get in!!
reviews.title: An absolute 5* gem..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Old Vicarage. The B&B was immaculate as was the food and the welcome.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just arrived home from a three night stay at The Old Vicarage, Rye Harbour, and felt a need to let you know what an exceptional B and B this is ! On arrival there was a warm welcome from owners Simon and Tracey, and we felt immediately at home in this immaculate, comfortable and characterful house. Rarely have we stayed in such a lovely room, which was far better decorated and equipped than many good hotels we have stayed at. Ours had it's own dressing room and the bathroom was a joy to use, with power shower enough to blow your socks off !
reviews.title: Exquisite !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prepare yourself for a great breakfast ! Both Simon and Tracey take great pleasure in cooking and serving some beautifully prepared and locally sourced food. They also provided some lovely home-cooked shortbread or little pastries for us each day...a nice touch ! They are dedicated to your stay and very keen to please--on hand and ready for a good chat when you need them but are also aware of your need for privacy.
reviews.title: A Welcome Breath of Fresh Air

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rye Harbour was a good base for us, with Rye just a few minutes away in the car. Although the harbour area is not as quaint as Rye, there is a certain appeal to the simplicity of the estuary and the surrounding landscape. A long walk along the River and Nature Reserve is a great way to walk off an evening meal ! Lin and Aylwyn
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!!

description: A delightful Victorian house standing prominently in the characterful village of Rye Harbour on the edge of the Nature Reserve, with stunning & ever-changing views of the river Rother running out to Sea. A perfect blend of Victorian character and modern styling with a few luxuries thrown in. All rooms have flat screen TV; iPod docking and charging station; Wi-Fi access; free tea and coffee and luxury showers. A friendly and warm welcome awaits you.
